title: Fix silent update failures and improve temp file management
description:
**Bug**: Update from v2.6.2 to v2.6.3 fails silently. Download succeeds, .bak file created, but update stops at copy phase. Root cause: stale temp directories from previous failed updates block new extractions.

**Root Cause Analysis**:
- Static folder name 'burndown_update_temp' causes conflicts
- Existing folders not cleaned before extraction
- Updater output went to /dev/null (no error visibility)
- Generic naming pattern risks collision with other apps

**Fixes Implemented**:
1. Unique extraction directories: burndown_chart_update_{uuid} (prevents conflicts)
2. Updater logging: Output to %TEMP%\burndown_chart_updater.log (diagnostic visibility)
3. Automatic cleanup: Remove orphaned folders >1hr old on app startup
4. Consistent naming: All temp resources use 'burndown_chart_*' namespace
5. Fail-fast: Abort if cleanup fails (defensive programming)

**Files Changed**:
- updater/updater.py: Unique extract dirs, defensive cleanup
- data/update_manager.py: Redirect updater output to log file
- app.py: Cleanup orphaned extraction directories
